\documentclass[english]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[latin9]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}

\title{Exercises}
\maketitle

\subsubsection*{1.}

Solve numerically the following equation:

\[
U^{\prime\prime}+U-\frac{Gm}{h^{2}}=0
\]


\subsubsection*{2. }

From

\[
\frac{\dot{r}\left(\vec{r}\cdot\vec{r}\right)-\left(\vec{r}\cdot\dot{\vec{r}}\right)\vec{r}}{r^{3}},
\]
derive

\[
\left(\frac{\left(\vec{r}\times\dot{\vec{r}}\right)\times\vec{r}}{r^{3}}\right),
\]
using 
\[
\vec{A}\times\left(\vec{B}\times\vec{C}\right)=\vec{A}\left(\vec{B}\cdot\vec{C}\right)-\left(\vec{A}\cdot\vec{B}\right)\vec{C}.
\]


\subsubsection*{3.}

From

\[
GM\left(\frac{\vec{r}}{r}+\vec{e}\right)\cdot\vec{r}=\left(\dot{\vec{r}}\times\vec{h}\right)\cdot\vec{r}
\]
derive

\begin{eqnarray*}
GM\left(\frac{\vec{r}}{r}+\vec{e}\right)\cdot\vec{r} & = & \left(\vec{r}\times\dot{\vec{r}}\right)\cdot\vec{h},\\
 & = & h^{2}.
\end{eqnarray*}
using 
\[
\left(\vec{A}\times\vec{B}\right)\cdot\vec{C}=\left(\vec{C}\times\vec{A}\right)\cdot\vec{B}.
\]


\subsubsection*{4.}

From

\[
\vec{f}=GM\vec{e}=\dot{\vec{r}}\times\left(\vec{r}\times\dot{\vec{r}}\right)-GM\frac{\vec{r}}{r}
\]
derive

\[
GM\vec{e}=\left[v^{2}-\frac{GM}{r}\right]\vec{r}-\left(\dot{\vec{r}}\cdot\vec{r}\right)\dot{\vec{r}}
\]


\subsubsection*{5. }

What is the Vernal point?

\subsubsection*{6. }

Solve numerically the Kepler's equation:

\[
E-e\sin E=M,
\]
for $M=1$ with 12 decimal digits of precision.

\subsubsection*{7. }

Since 

\[
\cos f=\frac{\cos E-e}{1-e\cos E}
\]

compute explicitly 
\[
\sin f
\]

and

\[
\tan f,
\]
in order to get

\[
\tan\frac{f}{2}=\sqrt{\frac{1+e}{1-e}}\tan\left(\frac{E}{2}\right).
\]


\subsubsection*{8.}

Calculate

\[
\frac{d\hat{l}}{dt}=\frac{d\varOmega}{dt}\left(\begin{array}{c}
-\sin\varOmega\\
\cos\varOmega\\
0
\end{array}\right).
\]


\subsubsection*{9.}

Find the five osculating elements:

\begin{eqnarray*}
\frac{da}{dt} & = & \frac{2}{n\sqrt{1-e^{2}}}\left[Re\sin f+\frac{SP}{r}\right]\\
\frac{de}{dt} & = & \frac{\sqrt{1-e^{2}}}{na}\left[Re\sin f+S\left(\cos f+\cos E\right)\right]\\
\frac{di}{dt} & = & \frac{r\cos\phi}{na^{2}\sqrt{1-e^{2}}}W\\
\frac{d\varOmega}{dt} & = & \frac{r\sin\phi}{na^{2}\sqrt{1-e^{2}}\sin i}W\\
\frac{d\omega}{dt} & = & -\cos i\frac{d\varOmega}{dt}+\frac{\sqrt{1-e^{2}}}{nae}\left[R\cos f+S\left(1+\frac{r}{P}\right)\sin f\right]
\end{eqnarray*}

\end{document}
